description.narrative:
This project aims to support CAFOD partners across West Africa and Great Lakes (WAGL), namely national and local Justice and Peace Commissions, in becoming stronger advocates for good governance in their respective countries, with a focus on election monitoring.
This programme is the first regional programme across several countries in (WAGL). The project will provide direct capacity strengthening support to the Regional Episcopal Conference of West Africa (RECOWA), building on success stories of support to other Regional Bishops conferences in Africa, in order to amplify the Church’s voice on promoting justice and good governance across West Africa.
All WAGL countries have recognised Governance as a core element of their country/regional strategies. From 2015 through to 2017, all countries within the WAGL region are expected to hold general and local elections. Partners across the region are involved at various levels in trying to ensure free and fair elections, and this programme will allow 6-8 partners to come together and learn from each other’s experience, and receive training in a workshop in Abuja, also attended by CAFOD staff. The workshop will allow space for sharing and learning on other governance related activities, and identify opportunities for ongoing collaboration between partners across the region, and for specific training where gaps are identified will be sought.
